title: How to Make a Sand Castle Cake

steps.headline: Take a long, serrated knife and trim any bubbles or uneven spots on the tops of the cakes.
steps.description: Flatten and even out the tops as much as possible to get a more presentable surface.

steps.headline: Take the square cake and measure a 5 ⁄2 inch (14.0 cm) and a 3 ⁄2 inch (8.9 cm) circle.
steps.description: Carefully cut it out and dust any crumbs off.

steps.headline: Use the 8-inch round cake as your bottom layer and frost it.
steps.description: Then take the 5 ⁄2 inch (14.0 cm) circle and place it at one of the edges of the 8 inch (20.3 cm) and frost it. Carefully place the 3 ⁄2 inch (8.9 cm) circle on top of the 5 ⁄2 inch (14.0 cm) circle at its edge and frost this layer. It should form something like a staircase instead of regular cake layers.

steps.headline: Use your own technique of crumbling the wafers.
steps.description: You can either place them in a sandwich bag and smash them, roll them with a rolling pin, or blend them with a food processor to make crumbs.

steps.headline: Cover the frosting with the wafer crumbs and press it into the frosting.
steps.description: The wafer crumbs will resemble the "sand" of your castle.

steps.headline: Take each ice cream cup and spread a little bit of frosting on the bottom of them.
steps.description: Place them around the cake, for example a few around the bottom layer and one at the very top.

steps.headline: Shorten 2 of the 6 sugar cones by trimming off about 1 ⁄2 inches (3.8 cm) of the top part.
steps.description: Use a dab of frosting around the edges of each of them and place them upside down (pointy-side up) on each ice cream cup.

steps.headline: Place 2 whole graham cracker sticks into the middle cake layer as the doors.
steps.description: Divide the rest of the graham cracker sticks in half and place them around the rims of the layers. Use the rest of the wafer crumbs (or break some leftover graham cracker sticks into crumbs) around the outside of the cake for the final touch.

steps.headline: Add your own goodies and candies to the castle for a castle "touch".
steps.description: Get round candy to use as rocks, goldfish crackers to use around the cake, etc.

text: Take a long, serrated knife and trim any bubbles or uneven spots on the tops of the cakes. Flatten and even out the tops as much as possible to get a more presentable surface. Take the square cake and measure a 5 ⁄2 inch (14.0 cm) and a 3 ⁄2 inch (8.9 cm) circle. Carefully cut it out and dust any crumbs off. Use the 8-inch round cake as your bottom layer and frost it. Then take the 5 ⁄2 inch (14.0 cm) circle and place it at one of the edges of the 8 inch (20.3 cm) and frost it. Carefully place the 3 ⁄2 inch (8.9 cm) circle on top of the 5 ⁄2 inch (14.0 cm) circle at its edge and frost this layer. It should form something like a staircase instead of regular cake layers. Use your own technique of crumbling the wafers. You can either place them in a sandwich bag and smash them, roll them with a rolling pin, or blend them with a food processor to make crumbs. Cover the frosting with the wafer crumbs and press it into the frosting. The wafer crumbs will resemble the "sand" of your castle. Take each ice cream cup and spread a little bit of frosting on the bottom of them. Place them around the cake, for example a few around the bottom layer and one at the very top. Shorten 2 of the 6 sugar cones by trimming off about 1 ⁄2 inches (3.8 cm) of the top part. Use a dab of frosting around the edges of each of them and place them upside down (pointy-side up) on each ice cream cup. Place 2 whole graham cracker sticks into the middle cake layer as the doors. Divide the rest of the graham cracker sticks in half and place them around the rims of the layers. Use the rest of the wafer crumbs (or break some leftover graham cracker sticks into crumbs) around the outside of the cake for the final touch. Add your own goodies and candies to the castle for a castle "touch". Get round candy to use as rocks, goldfish crackers to use around the cake, etc. Finished.
